Classical.Structure: Includes bone, cartilage, fat, blood, and loose/dense fibrous tissues (fascia). Characterized by an extensive extracellular matrix (ECM).
Classical.Function: Structural support, protection, insulation, transport, and binding of tissues.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: A coherent quantum network. Gap junctions (connexons) within the tissue (esp. fascia) are high-fidelity quantum channels that generate inter-cellular entanglement, transforming the tissue into an irreducible, quantum-computational entity. [cite: 1479, 1489, 1812-1819]

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'fabric' of the body that holds everything together. The medium for information, analogous to the 'ether' or 'akasha'.

Falsification_Hypotheses: Perturbing gap-junction coherence (e.g., with specific blockers) will show no change in tissue-wide entanglement proxies (e.g., bioelectric field stability). [cite: 1496]
Gap junctions will show a classical signal-to-noise ratio, not the predicted high-fidelity quantum bandwidth. [cite: 1820]
Experimental_Protocols: Measure quantum entanglement entropy (S_entanglement) across a sheet of epithelial or fascial cells. [cite: 1825]
Measure the quantum channel capacity (C) of a single gap junction. [cite: 1827]
